Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant is inadmissible under subsection 34(1)(f) of IRPA due to membership in an organization engaging in subversion by force
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant admitted membership in the CLA, which engaged in subversive acts; minimal involvement and lack of knowledge acknowledged
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Applicant seeking refugee status in Canada
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Nominal membership in CLA without active participation or knowledge of subversive activities
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Membership in an organization reasonably believed to engage in subversion by force
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Membership does not require knowledge or active involvement
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Evaluation of discretion, jurisprudence, and adequacy of reasons by the Board
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's claims of nominal involvement accepted but legally irrelevant
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Admission of CLA membership, documentation on CLA’s subversive activities
Crimes.Governing_Rule: A person is inadmissible if they are a member of an organization reasonably believed to engage in subversion by force
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Immigration Division of the Immigration and Refugee Board
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential threat to Canadian immigration integrity
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant deemed inadmissible due to CLA membership despite claiming nominal involvement
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Admissions treated as conclusive evidence of membership
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No challenge to authenticity or credibility of membership admission
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: N/A – claimant not a permanent resident
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of the Board to assess inadmissibility under IRPA
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Statutory definition of membership is objective and does not require intent or knowledge
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Objective test for membership under IRPA

Crimes.Crime_Name: Membership in an organization engaging in subversion against a government by force
Crimes.National_Security_Element: Engagement in armed attacks against a foreign government
Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Risk of association with violent subversive groups
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: CLA conducted armed attacks against Namibian government
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Membership in group using force to undermine state authority
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Armed attacks and subversion against Namibia’s government
Crimes.Organization_Involved: CLC (Caprivi Liberation Army or similar group)
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Minimal participation, no direct involvement in violence
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Relevance of lack of knowledge or involvement in determining membership
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Applicant's account considered credible but legally insufficient
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Consistency of testimony, lack of motive to lie
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Credible but immaterial due to strict liability nature of provision
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: None – admission was clear and uncontroverted
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Membership defined broadly without requirement for knowledge or action
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Finding of inadmissibility based on membership
Crimes.Process: Refugee protection claim leading to inadmissibility assessment
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Adequacy of reasons and application of law by the Board
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness of Board's interpretation and outcome
Crimes.Deportation_Risk: High – inadmissibility may lead to removal
